content:
RNA-DNA Variant Analysis - Somatic Mutation Detection

Performs comprehensive somatic mutation detection from matched RNA and DNA sequencing data. Distinguishes true somatic variants from RNA editing events using multi-algorithm consensus calling and specialized RNA realignment strategies.

What is RNA-DNA Variant Analysis?

RNA-DNA Variant Analysis addresses the challenge of detecting somatic mutations in RNA sequencing data, which has higher background noise and RNA editing events (A-to-I changes) that can be mistaken for true mutations. This pipeline integrates DNA evidence to validate RNA variants and applies specialized filtering to separate biological signal from technical artifacts.

Key Features

  • Multi-Algorithm Consensus: Combines Mutect2, Strelka2, and SAGE for robust variant calling
  • RNA-Specific Processing: Specialized realignment and filtering for RNA noise reduction
  • RNA Editing Detection: Identifies and filters A-to-I and other RNA editing events
  • GATK Best Practices: Follows established guidelines for data cleanup and QC
  • Parallel Processing: Efficient multi-sample analysis with reproducible containerization

Pipeline Workflow

  1. Quality Control: FastQC and read trimming for both RNA and DNA samples
  2. Alignment: Map reads to reference genome with appropriate aligners
  3. Preprocessing: GATK best practices including base quality recalibration
  4. Variant Calling: Run Mutect2, Strelka2, and SAGE in parallel
  5. RNA Realignment: Optional HISAT2 realignment at mutation sites for accuracy
  6. Consensus Calling: Combine results from multiple callers
  7. Annotation: VEP functional annotation of detected variants
  8. Filtering: Remove RNA editing events and low-confidence calls

Scientific Applications

  • Cancer Research: Identify somatic mutations expressed in tumor transcriptomes
  • Driver Mutation Discovery: Find functionally relevant cancer-driving variants
  • RNA Editing Studies: Catalog A-to-I editing sites across samples
  • Personalized Medicine: Detect actionable mutations for treatment selection
  • Transcriptome Validation: Confirm DNA variants are transcribed

Input Requirements

  • Sample Sheet: CSV/TSV with sample IDs, RNA FASTQ files, and optional DNA FASTQ files
  • Reference Genome: FASTA file with genome sequence
  • Reference Index: Genome index files for aligners (BWA, STAR/HISAT2)
  • Known Variants: dbSNP and other variant databases for filtering

Main Outputs

  • Consensus VCF: High-confidence somatic variants called by multiple algorithms
  • Annotated MAF: Mutation Annotation Format with functional predictions
  • RNA Editing Sites: Cataloged A-to-I and other editing events
  • Alignment Statistics: BAM files and mapping quality metrics
  • MultiQC Report: Comprehensive quality control summary

Perfect for: Cancer Genomics • Somatic Mutation Detection • RNA Editing Analysis • Tumor Transcriptomes • Precision Oncology • Driver Gene Discovery
